text: {{Infobox writer | name = Mark Juddery | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Stanford Mark Juddery | birth_date = | birth_place = Canberra, Australia | death_date = | death_place = Canberra, Australia | occupation = | language = | nationality = Australian | website = }} Stanford Mark Juddery (8 March 1971 - 13 January 2015) was an Australian freelance journalist, author, and columnist. His work has appeared in such newspapers as The Canberra Times, The Australian, and The Sydney Morning Herald. He also worked for magazines including The Bulletin, Empire, Inside Sport, Mad Magazine and Griffith Review. He also wrote the book Best. Times. Ever. (2014). Juddery died from cancer on 13 January 2015 in Canberraat age 43. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1971 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Australian journalists Category:Cancer deaths in Australia Category:Columnists Category:People from Canberra
title: Mark Juddery
